abstract: Building Blocks column examines legacy of John C Whitehead, chairman of the Lower Manhattan Development Corp who has died at age 92; Whitehead will be remembered, among his other accomplishments, for his principled and risky stand against former Gov George E Pataki after he attempted to halt construction of a cultural building at the World Trade Center site.
lead_paragraph: John C. Whitehead, who was the chairman of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation, criticized Gov. George E. Pataki for stopping plans for a cultural building at the World Trade Center site.

headline.main: In Politics of Rebuilding Ground Zero, a Lone Critical Voice
headline.print_headline: In Politics of Rebuilding Ground Zero, a Lone Critical Voice

snippet: John C. Whitehead, who was the chairman of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation, criticized Gov. George E. Pataki for stopping plans for a cultural building at the World Trade Center site.
